channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Graph Diffusion Policy Optimization
item.description: Recent research has made significant progress in optimizing diffusion models for specific downstream objectives, which is an important pursuit in fields such as graph generation for drug design.

item.title: DCVSMNet: Double Cost Volume Stereo Matching Network
item.description: We introduce Double Cost Volume Stereo Matching Network(DCVSMNet) which is a novel architecture characterised by by two small upper (group-wise) and lower (norm correlation) cost volumes.

item.title: HumanEval-XL: A Multilingual Code Generation Benchmark for Cross-lingual Natural Language Generalization
item.description: These benchmarks have overlooked the vast landscape of massively multilingual NL to multilingual code, leaving a critical gap in the evaluation of multilingual LLMs.

item.title: Improving LLM-based Machine Translation with Systematic Self-Correction
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have achieved impressive results in Machine Translation (MT).

item.title: Stable Training of Normalizing Flows for High-dimensional Variational Inference
item.description: However, in practice, training deep normalizing flows for approximating high-dimensional posterior distributions is often infeasible due to the high variance of the stochastic gradients.

item.title: A Provably Accurate Randomized Sampling Algorithm for Logistic Regression
item.description: When the number of observations greatly exceeds the number of predictor variables, we present a simple, randomized sampling-based algorithm for logistic regression problem that guarantees high-quality approximations to both the estimated probabilities and the overall discrepancy of the model.

item.title: TOTEM: TOkenized Time Series EMbeddings for General Time Series Analysis
item.description: To this end, we explore the impact of discrete, learnt, time series data representations that enable generalist, cross-domain training.

item.title: Pre-training Cross-lingual Open Domain Question Answering with Large-scale Synthetic Supervision
item.description: Cross-lingual question answering (CLQA) is a complex problem, comprising cross-lingual retrieval from a multilingual knowledge base, followed by answer generation either in English or the query language.

item.title: Training Implicit Generative Models via an Invariant Statistical Loss
item.description: In this work, we develop a discriminator-free method for training one-dimensional (1D) generative implicit models and subsequently expand this method to accommodate multivariate cases.

item.title: MoZIP: A Multilingual Benchmark to Evaluate Large Language Models in Intellectual Property
item.description: In this paper, we contribute a new benchmark, the first Multilingual-oriented quiZ on Intellectual Property (MoZIP), for the evaluation of LLMs in the IP domain.

item.title: Model-based deep reinforcement learning for accelerated learning from flow simulations
item.description: Employing simulation-based environments in reinforcement learning enables a priori end-to-end optimization of the control system, provides a virtual testbed for safety-critical control applications, and allows to gain a deep understanding of the control mechanisms.

item.title: An Integrated Data Processing Framework for Pretraining Foundation Models
item.description: The ability of the foundation models heavily relies on large-scale, diverse, and high-quality pretraining data.

item.title: MV-Swin-T: Mammogram Classification with Multi-view Swin Transformer
item.description: Traditional deep learning approaches for breast cancer classification has predominantly concentrated on single-view analysis.

item.title: Deep Rating Elicitation for New Users in Collaborative Filtering
item.description: Recent recommender systems started to use rating elicitation, which asks new users to rate a small seed itemset for inferring their preferences, to improve the quality of initial recommendations.

item.title: LLM Inference Unveiled: Survey and Roofline Model Insights
item.description: Our survey stands out from traditional literature reviews by not only summarizing the current state of research but also by introducing a framework based on roofline model for systematic analysis of LLM inference techniques.

item.title: SPINEPS -- Automatic Whole Spine Segmentation of T2-weighted MR images using a Two-Phase Approach to Multi-class Semantic and Instance Segmentation
item.description: Training on auto-generated annotations and evaluating on manually corrected test data from the GNC yielded global dice scores of 0. 900 for vertebrae, 0. 960 for intervertebral discs, and 0. 947 for the spinal canal.

item.title: ShieldLM: Empowering LLMs as Aligned, Customizable and Explainable Safety Detectors
item.description: The safety of Large Language Models (LLMs) has gained increasing attention in recent years, but there still lacks a comprehensive approach for detecting safety issues within LLMs' responses in an aligned, customizable and explainable manner.

item.title: Placing Objects in Context via Inpainting for Out-of-distribution Segmentation
item.description: In our experiments, we present different anomaly segmentation datasets based on POC-generated data and show that POC can improve the performance of recent state-of-the-art anomaly fine-tuning methods in several standardized benchmarks.

item.title: HiGPT: Heterogeneous Graph Language Model
item.description: However, existing frameworks for heterogeneous graph learning have limitations in generalizing across diverse heterogeneous graph datasets.

item.title: Budget-Constrained Tool Learning with Planning
item.description: Despite intensive efforts devoted to tool learning, the problem of budget-constrained tool learning, which focuses on resolving user queries within a specific budget constraint, has been widely overlooked.

item.title: FuseChat: Knowledge Fusion of Chat Models
item.description: Recently, \textsc{FuseLLM} introduced the concept of knowledge fusion to transfer the collective knowledge of multiple structurally varied LLMs into a target LLM through lightweight continual training.

item.title: Semi-supervised Open-World Object Detection
item.description: We demonstrate the effectiveness of our SS-OWOD problem setting and approach for remote sensing object detection, proposing carefully curated splits and baseline performance evaluations.

item.title: Detecting Machine-Generated Texts by Multi-Population Aware Optimization for Maximum Mean Discrepancy
item.description: Unfortunately, it is challenging to distinguish MGTs and human-written texts because the distributional discrepancy between them is often very subtle due to the remarkable performance of LLMs.

item.title: Cross-Resolution Land Cover Classification Using Outdated Products and Transformers
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Transformerbased weakly supervised method for cross-resolution land cover classification using outdated data.

item.title: Deep Homography Estimation for Visual Place Recognition
item.description: Moreover, we design a re-projection error of inliers loss to train the DHE network without additional homography labels, which can also be jointly trained with the backbone network to help it extract the features that are more suitable for local matching.

item.title: ASEM: Enhancing Empathy in Chatbot through Attention-based Sentiment and Emotion Modeling
item.description: Effective feature representations play a critical role in enhancing the performance of text generation models that rely on deep neural networks.

item.title: Towards Fair Graph Anomaly Detection: Problem, New Datasets, and Evaluation
item.description: The Fair Graph Anomaly Detection (FairGAD) problem aims to accurately detect anomalous nodes in an input graph while ensuring fairness and avoiding biased predictions against individuals from sensitive subgroups such as gender or political leanings.

item.title: ROS-Causal: A ROS-based Causal Analysis Framework for Human-Robot Interaction Applications
item.description: Deploying robots in human-shared spaces requires understanding interactions among nearby agents and objects.

item.title: InstructEdit: Instruction-based Knowledge Editing for Large Language Models
item.description: Knowledge editing for large language models can offer an efficient solution to alter a model's behavior without negatively impacting the overall performance.

item.title: How Large Language Models Encode Context Knowledge? A Layer-Wise Probing Study
item.description: Previous work has showcased the intriguing capability of large language models (LLMs) in retrieving facts and processing context knowledge.

item.title: Say More with Less: Understanding Prompt Learning Behaviors through Gist Compression
item.description: It finetunes the compression plugin module and uses the representations of gist tokens to emulate the raw prompts in the vanilla language model.

item.title: Towards Accurate Post-training Quantization for Reparameterized Models
item.description: Our framework outperforms previous methods by approximately 1\% for 8-bit PTQ and 2\% for 6-bit PTQ, showcasing its superior performance.

item.title: Don't Forget Your Reward Values: Language Model Alignment via Value-based Calibration
item.description: While Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) significantly enhances the generation quality of Large Language Models (LLMs), recent studies have raised concerns regarding the complexity and instability associated with the Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) algorithm, proposing a series of order-based calibration methods as viable alternatives.

item.title: Language Models for Code Completion: A Practical Evaluation
item.description: InCoder outperformed the other models across all programming languages, highlighting the significance of training data and objectives.

item.title: Disentangled Graph Variational Auto-Encoder for Multimodal Recommendation with Interpretability
item.description: While the incorporation of multimodal information could enhance the interpretability of these systems, current multimodal models represent users and items utilizing entangled numerical vectors, rendering them arduous to interpret.

item.title: IR2: Information Regularization for Information Retrieval
item.description: This approach, representing a novel application of regularization techniques in synthetic data creation for IR, is tested on three recent IR tasks characterized by complex queries: DORIS-MAE, ArguAna, and WhatsThatBook.

item.title: How Can LLM Guide RL? A Value-Based Approach
item.description: Specifically, we develop an algorithm named LINVIT that incorporates LLM guidance as a regularization factor in value-based RL, leading to significant reductions in the amount of data needed for learning, particularly when the difference between the ideal policy and the LLM-informed policy is small, which suggests that the initial policy is close to optimal, reducing the need for further exploration.

item.title: Diving Deep into Regions: Exploiting Regional Information Transformer for Single Image Deraining
item.description: Our RTB is used for attention selection of rain-affected and unaffected regions and local modeling of mixed scales.

item.title: StochCA: A Novel Approach for Exploiting Pretrained Models with Cross-Attention
item.description: By doing so, queries and channel-mixing multi-layer perceptron layers of a target model are fine-tuned to target tasks to learn how to effectively exploit rich representations of pretrained models.

item.title: TMT: Tri-Modal Translation between Speech, Image, and Text by Processing Different Modalities as Different Languages
item.description: We propose a novel Tri-Modal Translation (TMT) model that translates between arbitrary modalities spanning speech, image, and text.

item.title: LSTP: Language-guided Spatial-Temporal Prompt Learning for Long-form Video-Text Understanding
item.description: Despite progress in video-language modeling, the computational challenge of interpreting long-form videos in response to task-specific linguistic queries persists, largely due to the complexity of high-dimensional video data and the misalignment between language and visual cues over space and time.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Challenges in Machine Learning Asset Management
item.description: In machine learning (ML), efficient asset management, including ML models, datasets, algorithms, and tools, is vital for resource optimization, consistent performance, and a streamlined development lifecycle.

item.title: VOLoc: Visual Place Recognition by Querying Compressed Lidar Map
item.description: Then the QPC is compressed by the same GPC, and is aggregated into a global descriptor by an attention-based aggregation module, to query the compressed Lidar map in the vector space.

item.title: Spectrum Extraction and Clipping for Implicitly Linear Layers
item.description: We show the effectiveness of automatic differentiation in efficiently and correctly computing and controlling the spectrum of implicitly linear operators, a rich family of layer types including all standard convolutional and dense layers.

item.title: PST-Bench: Tracing and Benchmarking the Source of Publications
item.description: Tracing the source of research papers is a fundamental yet challenging task for researchers.

item.title: A VAE-based Framework for Learning Multi-Level Neural Granger-Causal Connectivity
item.description: Granger causality has been widely used in various application domains to capture lead-lag relationships amongst the components of complex dynamical systems, and the focus in extant literature has been on a single dynamical system.

item.title: Towards Robust Image Stitching: An Adaptive Resistance Learning against Compatible Attacks
item.description: Given a pair of captured images, subtle perturbations and distortions which go unnoticed by the human visual system tend to attack the correspondence matching, impairing the performance of image stitching algorithms.

item.title: Query Augmentation by Decoding Semantics from Brain Signals
item.description: If the quality of the initially retrieved documents is low, then the effectiveness of query augmentation would be limited as well.

item.title: PhyPlan: Compositional and Adaptive Physical Task Reasoning with Physics-Informed Skill Networks for Robot Manipulators
item.description: PhyPlan leverages PINNs to simulate and predict outcomes of actions in a fast and accurate manner and uses MCTS for planning.

item.title: MATHWELL: Generating Educational Math Word Problems at Scale
item.description: Math word problems are critical K-8 educational tools, but writing them is time-consuming and requires domain expertise.
